question.title: What is the characteristic that distinguishes basal cell carcinoma from other types of skin cancer?

option_a.title: A pearly border
option_a.description: A pearly border is a characteristic of basal cell carcinoma, but it can also be seen in other types of skin cancer

option_b.title: A translucent nodule
option_b.description: A translucent nodule can be a sign of basal cell carcinoma, but it can also be seen in other types of skin cancer

option_c.title: Erythematosquamous plaque
option_c.description: Erythematosquamous plaque is a characteristic of superficial basal cell carcinoma, but it can also be seen in other types of skin cancer

option_d.title: Nodular appearance
option_d.description: Nodular appearance is a characteristic of basal cell carcinoma, but it can also be seen in other types of skin cancer

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The correct answer is a characteristic of basal cell carcinoma
